course.title: Statistics and Litigation
course.description: Interaction between quantitative methods and law. Teaming with law students: analyze data, prepare expert reports, and give testimony. Learn how to communicate with and present results to untrained but intelligent users, and to defend conclusions.
course.prerequisites: Basic knowledge of R programming and a graduate course in data analysis, such as Statistics 220, Economics 2120, or a 2000-level quantitative Government course. No knowledge of legal issues is presumed.
